intro: Euphorbia wildii, commonly known as the "Cape wild cucumber," is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its unique, spiny stems and leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia. Euphorbia wildii is adapted to arid environments and can store water in its thick, fleshy stems. It is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
